subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Test case
msgSnippet: ... [code snipped] ... IMHO the assertion is not required here, after all you do fail anyway, so why bother with the exception type? You could as well remove
messageBody:
On Tuesday 02 March 2004 14:42, khatrihemant wrote:
> This is my positive testcase. is there any make sense of below
> statement in following testcase?
> is it require?

[code snipped]

> catch (Exception e) {
> assertTrue(e instanceof CustomerException || e instanceof
> CompanyException);
> e.printStackTrace();
> fail();
> }

IMHO the assertion is not required here, after all you do fail anyway, so
why bother with the exception type?
You could as well remove the try/catch block and declare the test to throw
Exception.


Robert
